thread.title: People are filled with guilt thanks to this sign thanking everyone for not feeding ducks bread
thread.title_full: People are filled with guilt thanks to this sign thanking everyone for not feeding ducks bread

author: Ellen Scott
title: People are filled with guilt thanks to this sign thanking everyone for not feeding ducks bread
text:
(Picture: Getty) Ever popped to the park with a loaf of bread you bought as a special treat for the ducks?
Well, youâ€™re a monster. An evil, duck-destroying monster.
But donâ€™t panic: youâ€™re not alone.
Over on Twitter, people are in mass meltdown after a sign thanking people for not feeding bread to ducks was shared all over the place.
Why? Because weâ€™ve all been feeding ducks bread without a second thought, and are now racked with the deepest, darkest pangs of guilt.
It all started when someone shared a photo of a sign thanking people for not giving ducks any bread.
I'VE BEEN FEEDING DUCKS BREAD THIS WHOLE TIME IM SO ASHAMED IM SUCH A MONSTER pic.twitter.com/dzyicjJc7Q 
â€” not dallas (@proudsIytherin) March 22, 2017 

â€˜Thank you for not feeding us bread,â€™ reads the sign.
â€˜Bread makes us ill, as it does not contain the right nutrition or calories we need to keep us warm in winter.
â€˜Rotting bread pollutes our water and causes nasty surface algae, which kills our fish and gives us diseases. It also makes our water smell.â€™
So not only have we been failing to give ducks the nutrition they need, weâ€™ve also been ruining their water supply.
As we mentioned, we are monsters.
This message sparked a ripple of misery across the internet. i'm about to cry. i've fed so many ducks bread https://t.co/sCEn241ofv 
â€” Maddie Stibel (@maddiestibs) March 23, 2017 
i feel bad because i fed ducks bread many times as a kid
â€” v (@v21) March 23, 2017 
It's like that time my Mom befriended a duck by our pond and killed it because it didn't fly south for the winter lol https://t.co/82Pv3qrUWN 
â€” Jake Alleman (@Alleman_Joy) March 23, 2017 
been killing down ducks since i was about 6 then who knew they dont eat bread rip to all the fallen ducks pic.twitter.com/zCft8YpxLQ 
â€” chay (@chayalier) March 21, 2017 
IM SO SAD I ALWAYS GO TO THE POND AND FEED THE DUCKS BREAD https://t.co/90BgN2iysl 
â€” ashl (@ojnghyun) March 24, 2017 
MY HEART IS SAD PLEASE FEED DUCKS BUT JUST NOT W BREAD ðŸ¦† pic.twitter.com/hQ1lfBFPoI 
â€” local sad baby (@bemysaddaddy) March 24, 2017 

How many ducks have we made sick? How much damage have we caused? What have we done? 
If, like the rest of the world, you are now feeling very, very guilty, the best thing to do is to go to the park and feed your local ducks some healthy treats.
Think oats, corn, frozen peas, cooked rice, chopped lettuce, or seedless grapes (cut in half so the ducks donâ€™t choke).
We must to do this. We must make it up to the ducks.
